DOCNAME: CASE OF SAHIN AND SURGEC v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 5-3;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and were detained in NORP prison at the time of the lodging of their applications with the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were arrested and taken into police custody on suspicion of their involvement in the activities of the ORG ( ORG ) . On DATE ORG ordered their remand in custody .

CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor at ORG in his indictment , dated DATE , accused the first applicant of membership of the ORG and the second applicant of aiding and abetting that organisation . The charges were brought under LAW and CARDINAL of LAW and LAW no . ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicants as charged and sentenced the first applicant to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment and the second applicant to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment and a fine of MONEY .

CARDINAL . The parties did not submit any documents pertaining to the outcome of the criminal proceedings . However , in their submissions on just satisfaction , dated DATE , the applicants stated that ORG , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE on rehabilitation ( topluma kazandırma ) , had decided not to sentence the applicants ( ceza tertibi ) and suspended the proceedings . They further submitted that this decision was upheld by ORG .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law at the material time can be found in GPE v. GPE judgment ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
